task.title: Add a Font to the Built-in FO Processor - Simple Version

keywords.indexterm: Add fonts to built-in FO processor

context.p: If the font that must be set to Apache FOP is one of the fonts that are installed in the operating system you should follow the next steps for creating and setting a FOP configuration file that looks for the font that it needs in the system fonts. It is a simplified version of the procedure for setting a custom font in Apache FOP.

step.cmd: Register the font in FOP configuration. (This is not necessary for DITA PDF transformations, skip to the next step)

substep.cmd: Create a FOP configuration file that specifies that FOP should look for fonts in the installed fonts of the operating system.
, go to XML PDF Output FO Processors , and enter the path of the FOP configuration file in the Configuration file text field.

step.cmd: Set the font on the document content.
step.info: This is done usually with XSLT stylesheet parameters and depends on the document type processed by the stylesheet.

choices.choice: For DocBook documents you can start with the built-in scenario called DocBook PDF, edit the XSLT parameters and set the font name (for example, Arial Unicode MS) to the body.font.family and title.font.family parameters.
For TEI documents you can start with the built-in scenario called TEI PDF, edit the XSLT parameters and set the font name (for example, Arial Unicode MS) to the bodyFont and sansFont parameters.

For DITA transformations to PDF using DITA-OT you should modify the following two files:
/plugins/org.dita.pdf2/cfg/fo/font-mappings.xml - The font-face element included in each physical-font element that has the char-set="default" attribute must contain the name of the font (for example, Arial Unicode MS)
/plugins/org.dita.pdf2.fop/fop/conf/fop.xconf - An auto-detect element must be inserted in the fonts element, which is inside the renderer element that has the mime="application/pdf" attribute:<renderer mime="application/pdf"> . . . <fonts> <auto-detect/> </fonts> . . . </renderer>
